summary: Agent offers different modes optimized for specific tasks: Agent mode for complex features, Ask mode for learning and questions, Plan mode for detailed planning, and Debug mode for troubleshooting.
key_takeaways: Agent mode has all tools enabled for complex features and refactoring.
Ask mode is read-only for learning and exploring code without making changes.
Plan mode creates detailed implementation plans before writing code.
Debug mode uses hypothesis generation, log instrumentation, and runtime analysis for tricky bugs.

questions.question: Which Agent mode should you use when you want to explore code without making any changes?
questions.explanation: Ask mode is read-only and designed for learning and exploration. It searches your codebase and provides answers without making any changes, perfect for understanding code before modifying it.

questions.question: What keyboard shortcut quickly switches to Plan Mode from the chat input?
questions.explanation: Press Shift+Tab from the chat input to rotate to Plan Mode. Cursor also suggests it automatically when you type keywords that indicate complex tasks.

questions.question: When debugging with Debug Mode, what is the recommended approach if you're stuck after reproducing the bug?

options.text: Immediately make code changes based on your gut feeling
Switch to Agent mode and ask it to fix the bug directly
Reproduce the bug multiple times to help identify tricky issues like race conditions
Delete all the log statements and start over

questions.explanation: Reproducing the bug multiple times may help the agent identify particularly tricky problems like race conditions. Debug Mode uses runtime evidence rather than guessing at fixes.
